author: timbeiko
content: whoops, time on that was wrong: call is at 15:30 UTC, or ~1h10 from now

author: inphi
content:
We discussed the etheresearch post on raising the minimum data gas price today - https://ethresear.ch/t/eip-4844-fee-market-analysis/15078. No one that attended the call had any strong opinions against raising the minimum. But let's get some more eyes on this before going forward with it.
cc: <@555483069038198827>, <@415548822983278593>

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> I disagree with most of what is said in that post but I am a fan of a somewhat higher lower bound on data gas

author: bridge-bot

author: bridge-bot

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> I'm not too worried about the cold start problem in relation to spam. Blobs represent a constant load on the network (not linearly growing) so I don't think we should really care what is in them, spam or not. That constant value should be tuned to be fine for the network, regardless 

As for L2s being incentivized to swap early on (unrealistic expectations), I see that as a good thing. This is where scalable data will be in Ethereum. And by 1 to 1.5 years hopefully we have some at least moderate upticks in data gas limit

Additionally, with an independent blob market, dominantly used by L2s, I suspect additional L2 activity (maybe you could call much of it "spam") to fill the supply quickly

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> I stand by the argument that it's artificial to set a min eth price that might cause problems in the future
